segment.target: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology

segment.source: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology
segment.target: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology

segment.source: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology
segment.target: High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Stand-alone Topology

segment.source: This topic describes the recommended architecture for deploying Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Configuration Manager Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: This topic describes the recommended architecture for deploying Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with the Configuration Manager Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: In this topology, MBAM is deployed as a stand-alone product.
segment.target: In this topology, MBAM is deployed as a stand-alone product.

segment.source: You can alternatively deploy MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology, which integrates MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: You can alternatively deploy MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology, which integrates MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For more information, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
segment.target: For more information, see High-Level Architecture of MBAM 2.5 with Configuration Manager Integration Topology.

segment.source: For a list of the supported versions of the software mentioned in this topic, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For a list of the supported versions of the software mentioned in this topic, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: We recommend you use a single-server architecture in test environments only.
segment.target: We recommend you use a single-server architecture in test environments only.

segment.source: Recommended number of servers and supported number of clients
segment.target: Recommended number of servers and supported number of clients

segment.source: The recommended number of servers and supported number of clients in a production environment is as follows:
segment.target: The recommended number of servers and supported number of clients in a production environment is as follows:

segment.target: Recommended architecture in a production environment

segment.target: Details

segment.source: Number of servers and other computers
segment.target: Number of servers and other computers

segment.source: Two servers
segment.target: Two servers

segment.source: One workstation
segment.target: One workstation

segment.target: Number of client computers supported

segment.target: Recommended MBAM high-level architecture with the Stand-alone topology

segment.source: The following diagram and table describe the recommended high-level, two-server architecture for MBAM with the Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: The following diagram and table describe the recommended high-level, two-server architecture for MBAM with the Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: MBAM multi-forest deployments require a one-way or two-way trust.
segment.target: MBAM multi-forest deployments require a one-way or two-way trust.

segment.source: One-way trusts require that the server domain trusts the client domain.
segment.target: One-way trusts require that the server domain trusts the client domain.

segment.source: mbam2
segment.target: mbam2

segment.source: Server Features to configure on this server Description Database server
segment.target: Server Features to configure on this server Description Database server

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: The Compliance and Audit Database stores compliance data, which is used primarily for reports that SQL Server Reporting Services hosts.
segment.target: The Compliance and Audit Database stores compliance data, which is used primarily for reports that SQL Server Reporting Services hosts.

segment.source: Recovery Database
segment.target: Recovery Database

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: The Recovery Database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.
segment.target: The Recovery Database stores recovery data that is collected from MBAM client computers.

segment.source: Reports
segment.target: Reports

segment.source: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and supported SQL Server instance.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a server running Windows Server and supported SQL Server instance.

segment.source: The Reports provide recovery audit and compliance status data about the client computers in your enterprise.
segment.target: The Reports provide recovery audit and compliance status data about the client computers in your enterprise.

segment.source: You can access the reports from the Administration and Monitoring Website or directly from SQL Server Reporting Services.
segment.target: You can access the reports from the Administration and Monitoring Website or directly from SQL Server Reporting Services.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Server
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Server

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: The Administration and Monitoring Website is used to:
segment.target: The Administration and Monitoring Website is used to:

segment.source: Help end users regain access to their computers when they are locked out.
segment.target: Help end users regain access to their computers when they are locked out.

segment.source: (This area of the Website is commonly called the Help Desk.)
segment.target: (This area of the Website is commonly called the Help Desk.)

segment.source: View reports that show compliance status and recovery activity for client computers.
segment.target: View reports that show compliance status and recovery activity for client computers.

segment.source: Self-Service Portal
segment.target: Self-Service Portal

segment.source: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: The Self-Service Portal is a website that enables end users on client computers to independently log on to a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.
segment.target: The Self-Service Portal is a website that enables end users on client computers to independently log on to a website to get a recovery key if they lose or forget their BitLocker password.

segment.source: Monitoring web services for this website
segment.target: Monitoring web services for this website

segment.source: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.
segment.target: This feature is configured on a computer running Windows Server.

segment.source: The monitoring web services are used by the MBAM Client and the websites to communicate to the database.
segment.target: The monitoring web services are used by the MBAM Client and the websites to communicate to the database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The Monitoring Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 since the MBAM Client and the websites communicate directly with the Recovery Database.
segment.target: The Monitoring Web Service is no longer available in Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.5 SP1 since the MBAM Client and the websites communicate directly with the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Management workstation
segment.target: Management workstation

segment.source: MBAM Group Policy Templates
segment.target: MBAM Group Policy Templates

segment.source: The MBAM Group Policy Templates are Group Policy settings that define implementation settings for MBAM, which enable you to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: The MBAM Group Policy Templates are Group Policy settings that define implementation settings for MBAM, which enable you to manage BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: Before you run MBAM, you must download the Group Policy Templates from How to Get MDOP Group Policy (.admx) Templates and copy them to a server or workstation that is running a supported Windows Server or Windows operating system.
segment.target: Before you run MBAM, you must download the Group Policy Templates from How to Get MDOP Group Policy (.admx) Templates and copy them to a server or workstation that is running a supported Windows Server or Windows operating system.

segment.source: The workstation does not have to be a dedicated computer.
segment.target: The workstation does not have to be a dedicated computer.

segment.source: MBAM Client and Configuration Manager client computer
segment.target: MBAM Client and Configuration Manager client computer

segment.source: MBAM Client software
segment.target: MBAM Client software

segment.source: The MBAM Client:
segment.target: The MBAM Client:

segment.source: Uses Group Policy Objects to enforce BitLocker Drive Encryption on client computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: Uses Group Policy Objects to enforce BitLocker Drive Encryption on client computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Collects the Bitlocker recovery key for three data drive types: operating system drives, fixed data drives, and removable (USB) data drives.
segment.target: Collects the Bitlocker recovery key for three data drive types: operating system drives, fixed data drives, and removable (USB) data drives.

segment.source: Collects recovery information and computer information about the client computers.
segment.target: Collects recovery information and computer information about the client computers.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
